name: Pull Up
transcript:
1. Grab the pull up bar, hands facing forwards. Retract your shoulder blades and tilt your torso back. First Position.
  2. Bringing your lats up to your elbows, pull your torso up until your shoulders reach the height of your hands at Second Position. Ensure you contract your back muscles throughout every rep.
  3. Slow and controlled, fall back into First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Barbell Bicep Curl
transcript:
1. Standing upright, grip the barbell at shoulder width with your hands facing forwards and elbows tucked close to your side. First Position.
  2. Curl the weight upwards, towards your shoulders, contracting your biceps. Try to keep your upper arm in a locked position.
  3. Continue to curl until you reach Second Position, where your biceps are fully contracted.
  4. Slowly lower the weight back into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Dumbbell Skullcrushers
transcript:
1. Lie down on a flat bench. Hold a pair of dumbbells in either hand straight above you at shoulder width. First Position.
  2. Slowly begin to lower the dumbbells by letting your hands fall to the sides of your head. Keep your upper arm in a fixed position.
  3. When the dumbbells lightly touch your shoulders or the bench and your triceps are fully stretched, you've reached Second Position.
  4. Briefly hold Second Position before pressing the weight back up into First Position, contracting your triceps.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Tricep Pushdown
transcript:
1. Standing upright, grip a straight bar attached to a cable at shoulder width with your palms facing down. Retract your shoulder blades and tuck your elbows in by your side. Lightly push down so the weight releases from the stack. First Position.
  2. Contract your triceps and push the bar down until your arms are fully extended. Your upper arm should stay in a fixed position throughout. Second Position.
  3. Briefly hold and contract Second Position before slowly guiding the bar back up into First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Hammer Curls
transcript:
1. Standing upright, hold two dumbbells by your side with a neutral grip and your elbows tucked close to your side. First Position.
  2. Curl one dumbbell upwards, towards your shoulders, keeping your grip neutral. Try to keep your upper arm in a locked position.
  3. Continue to curl until you reach Second Position, where your biceps are fully contracted.
  4. Slowly lower the weight back into First Position.
  5. Repeat for your other arm.
  6. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Overhead Rope Extension
transcript:
1. Stand upright and face away from the cable machine. Grip the ropes, attached at the top of the cable, from behind your head with your palms facing inwards. Step and lean forwards so the weight releases from the stack and your triceps are fully stretched. First Position.
  2. Contract your triceps and push the ropes out in front of you until your arms are fully extended. Pull the ropes apart at the end of the movement. Your upper arm should stay in a fixed position and try to keep your hands apart throughout. Second Position.
  3. Briefly hold and contract Second Position before slowly guiding the ropes back into First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Cable Bicep Curl
transcript:
1. Standing upright, grip the straight bar attached to a cable at shoulder width with your palms facing upwards and elbows tucked close to your side. The weight should be released from the rack. First Position.
  2. Curl the weight upwards, towards your shoulders, contracting your biceps. Try to keep your upper arm in a locked position.
  3. Continue to curl until you reach Second Position, where your biceps are fully contracted.
  4. Slowly lower the weight back into First Position, just short of where the weight touches the rack.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Close Grip Push Ups
transcript:
1. Get into a press up position - arms fully extended - and put your hands together in the middle making a triangle between your thumbs and first fingers. First Position.
  2. Slow lower yourself down until your chest is just above the floor. Keep your elbows as tucked is as you can to maximise tricep engagement. Second Position.
  3. Contract your triceps and press your upper body back into First Position, locking your arms back into full extension.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Concentration Curl
transcript:
1. Sitting on the end of a bench, rest your upper arm against the the inside of your leg and hold a dumbbell in your hand with your palm facing upwards. First Position.
  2. Curl the weight upwards, towards your shoulders, contracting your bicep and keeping your palm facing upwards. Try to keep your upper arm in a locked position.
  3. Continue to curl until you reach Second Position, where your biceps are fully contracted.
  4. Slowly lower the weight back into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.
  6. Repeat for your other arm.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Crucifix Curls
transcript:
1. Set two ends of the cable machine to a medium height. Standing upright, grip the handles attached with your palms facing upwards. Lightly pull the weight to release it from the stack. First Position.
  2. Curl the handles inwards, towards your shoulders, contracting your biceps. Try to keep your upper arm in a locked position.
  3. Continue to curl until you reach Second Position, where your biceps are fully contracted and the handles reach your shoulders.
  4. Hold and contract Second Position for a second before slowly lowering the weight back into First Position, just short of where the weight touches the rack.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Tricep Dips
transcript:
1. Sit flat on the floor with your legs fully extended and your back to the side of a bench. Pulling your arms behind you and creating a right angle between your upper and lower arm, place your hands on the end of the bench. First Position.
  2. Contracting your triceps, push your torso up and fully extend your arms to reach Second Position. 
  3. Slow and controlled, fall back into First Position and pause briefly.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Overhand Barbell Curl
transcript:
1. Standing upright, grip the barbell at shoulder width with an overhand grip and your elbows tucked close to your side. Your hands should be facing downwards. First Position.
  2. Curl the weight upwards, towards your shoulders, contracting your biceps. Try to keep your upper arm in a locked position.
  3. Continue to curl until you reach Second Position, where your biceps are fully contracted.
  4. Slowly lower the weight back into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Preacher Curl
transcript:
1. Rest your upper arm against the pad of the bench at a high incline and hold a dumbbell in your hand with your palm facing upwards. First Position.
  2. Curl the weight upwards, towards your shoulder, contracting your bicep and maintaining your palm position.
  3. Continue to curl until you reach Second Position, where your biceps are fully contracted.
  4. Hold and contract Second Position for a second before slowly lowering the weight back into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.
  6. Repeat for your other arm.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Cable Hammer Curl
transcript:
1. Standing upright, grip the rope attached to a cable. Your grip should be neutral, with your palms facing inwards and your elbows tucked by your side. First Position.
  2. Curl the weight upwards, towards your shoulders, keeping your hands in a neutral position. Try to keep your upper arm in a locked position.
  3. Continue to curl until you reach Second Position, where your biceps are fully contracted.
  4. Slowly lower the weight back into First Position, just short of where the weight touches the rack.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Rope Pushdown
transcript:
1. Standing upright, grip the ropes attached to a cable with your palms facing inwards. Retract your shoulder blades and tuck your elbows in by your side. Lightly push down so the weight releases from the stack. First Position.
  2. Contract your triceps and push the ropes down until your arms are fully extended. Pull the ropes apart at the end of the movement. Your upper arm should stay in a fixed position and try to keep your hands apart throughout. Second Position.
  3. Briefly hold and contract Second Position before slowly guiding the ropes back up into First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Underhand Tricep Extension
transcript:
1. Standing upright, grip the underside of a straight bar attached to a cable at shoulder width. Your palms should be facing upwards. Retract your shoulder blades and tuck your elbows in by your side. Lightly pull down so the weight releases from the stack. First Position.
  2. Contract your triceps and pull the bar down until your arms are fully extended. Your upper arm should stay in a fixed position throughout. Second Position. 
  3. Briefly hold and contract Second Position before slowly guiding the bar back up into First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: V-Bar Pushdown
transcript:
1. Standing upright, grip the ends of a V-Bar attached to a cable with your palms facing down. Retract your shoulder blades and tuck your elbows in by your side. Lightly push down so the weight releases from the stack. First Position.
  2. Contract your triceps and push the V-Bar down until your arms are fully extended. Your upper arm should stay in a fixed position throughout. Second Position. 
  3. Briefly hold and contract Second Position before slowly guiding the V-Bar back up into First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Tricep Kickbacks
transcript:
1. Place your right or left arm and leg along a flat bench and bend your torso forwards so it's parallel to the floor.
  2. In your free hand, hold a dumbbell up by your side. Your upper arm should be alongside your upper body with your lower arm pointing down to the floor. First Position.
  3. Contract your tricep and push the dumbbell back and up, until your arm is fully extended. Keep your upper arm in a fixed position throughout. Second Position.
  4. Slow and controlled, lower the dumbbell back into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.
  6. Repeat for your other arm.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Spider Curls
transcript:
1. Lie face forward on a high incline bench and hold a dumbbell in either hand, palm facing upwards. First Position.
  2. Curl the dumbbells upwards, towards your shoulders, contracting your biceps throughout. Try to keep your upper arm in a locked position.
  3. Continue to curl until you reach Second Position, where your biceps are fully contracted.
  4. Slowly lower the weight back into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Overhead Dumbbell Extensions
transcript:
1. Sit on the end of a flat bench and hold one end of a dumbbell, creating a triangle with your first fingers and thumbs around the handle. 
  2. Lift the dumbbell straight above your head until your arms are fully extended. Your palms should be facing upwards. First Position.
  3. Slow and controlled, lower the dumbbell behind your head until your triceps are fully stretched. Try to keep your elbows tucked close to the side of your head. Second Position.
  4. Contract your triceps and press the dumbbell back up into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Deadlift
transcript:
1. Stand over the bar, centred over your feet, in a neutral stance. Let your arms rest by your side.
  2. Bend at the hip to grip the bar, either double overhand or alternating grip. First Position.
  3. Taking a deep breath, retract your shoulder blades, brace your core and bend your knees until your shins make contact with the bar. Second Position.
  4. Drive through your heels, pushing the floor away, to lift the bar.
  5. As you reach the top, pull the bar back, retracting your shoulder blades and driving your hips forward. Third Position.
  6. Guide the bar to the floor by bending at your hips and controlling a fall back to First Position.
  7. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Lat Pulldown
transcript:
1. Sit on a Lat Pulldown machine and grip a wide bar just outside shoulder width with your palms facing forwards. Tilt your torso slightly back and retract your shoulder blades. First Position.
  2. Pulling your elbows towards your lats, begin to pull the bar down until it reaches your upper chest. Second Position. Make sure you contract your back muscles throughout the movement.
  3. Slow and controlled, release the bar back up into First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Seated Cable Row
transcript:
1. Sit on a Cable Row machine (you may have to adjust the cable height so it sits at your mid-section). Grip a V-Bar with your palms facing inwards. 
  2. Straighten your legs slightly and retract your shoulder blades. Lean back so the weight releases from the stack. First Position.
  3. Pull the V-Bar towards your torso, pulling the weight through your elbows and tucking them in by your side. Touch your torso with the V-Bar. Second Position.
  4. Slowly guide the V-Bar back into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Straight Arm Pulldown
transcript:
1. Set a cable machine to its highest point and attach a straight bar.
  2. Grip the straight bar at shoulder width with an overhand grip, palms facing down. Take a few steps back from the cable machine, lean forwards slightly and extend your arms out in front of you. First Position.
  3. Contracting your back muscles, pull the bar down until it touches your thighs at Second Position.
  4. Slow and controlled, guide the bar back up into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Bent Over Row
transcript:
1. Bend your knees slightly and bend at your hips so your torso is over the barbell at a 45 degree angle minimum. Grip the bar with either an overhand or underhand grip.
  2. Pushing from the floor and extending your back, lift the bar slightly from the floor. First Position.
  3. Pull the barbell up towards your mid-section. Pull through your elbows and keep them tucked close to your side. Second Position. Contract your back muscles throughout the movement.
  4. Slow and controlled, lower the bar back into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Close Grip Lat Pulldown
transcript:
1. Sit on a Lat Pulldown machine with a close grip attachment and grip it so that your palms face inwards. Tilt your torso slightly back and retract your shoulder blades. First Position.
  2. Pulling your elbows towards your lats, begin to pull the bar down until it reaches your upper chest. Make sure you contract your back muscles throughout the movement. Second Position. 
  3. Slow and controlled, release the cable back up into First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Wide Grip Cable Row
transcript:
1. Sit on a Cable Row machine (you may have to adjust the cable height so it sits at your mid-section). Grip a wide straight bar just outside shoulder width with your palms facing down. 
  2. Straighten your legs slightly and retract your shoulder blades. Lightly lean back so the weight releases from the stack. First Position.
  3. Pull the straight bar towards your torso, pulling the weight through your elbows and keeping them close to your side. Touch your torso with the bar. Second Position.
  4. Slowly guide the weight back into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Underhand Lat Pulldown
transcript:
1. Sit on a Lat Pulldown machine and grip a wide bar at shoulder width with an underhand grip, palms facing towards you. Tilt your torso slightly back and retract your shoulder blades. First Position.
  2. Pulling your elbows towards your lats, begin to pull the bar down until it reaches your upper chest. Make sure you contract your back muscles throughout the movement. Second Position. 
  3. Slow and controlled, release the bar back up into First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Single Arm Rows
transcript:
1. Place your right or left arm and leg along a flat bench and bend your torso forwards so it's parallel to the floor.
  2. In your free hand, hold a dumbbell down below you at arm's length. First Position.
  3. Pull the dumbbell until it reaches your mid-section. Pull through your elbow and keep it tucked close to your side. Contract your back muscles throughout the movement. Second Position.
  4. Slow and controlled, lower the dumbbell back into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.
  6. Repeat for your other arm.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Good Mornings
transcript:
1. Set a squat rack to shoulder height and load the bar with your chosen weight. 
  2. Grip the bar just outside shoulder width. Step under and place the bar across the back of your shoulders.
  3. Lift the bar out of the rack and take a few steps back. Plant your feet at hip-width. Point your toes slightly outwards. First Position.
  4. Keep your legs in a fixed position and bend at your hips to lean your torso forwards. Continue to bend until your torso is parallel to the floor. Keep your neck and back straight throughout. Second Position.
  5. Pause in Second Position briefly.
  6. Still keeping your legs fixed, extended your back and raise your torso back up into First Position.
  7. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Renegade Rows
transcript:
1. With a dumbbell in either hand, get into a press up position. First Position.
  2. Brace your core to keep your balance and pull one dumbbell up until it reaches your torso. Pull through your elbow and keep it tucked close to your side. Second Position.
  3. Slow and controlled, lower the dumbbell back down to the floor and return to First Position.
  4. Repeat for your other arm.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Incline Bench Press
transcript:
1. Back slightly arched, shoulders pinned back, lie down on an incline bench.
  2. Grip the bar a few inches outside shoulder width and lift it from the rack. Hold it straight up, arms locked, above your chest. First Position.
  3. Take a deep breath and slowly lower the bar. Touch your chest and pause briefly. Second Position.
  4. Maintain your back arch and shoulder position. Contract your chest and press the bar. Lock your arms back into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Dumbbell Bench Press
transcript:
1. Set a bench to a flat position. Sit on the bench and grab a dumbbell in either hand and rest them on the ends of your legs. 
  2. Fall back to lie on the bench, raising the dumbbells upright above you with your arms extended. It may help to lift the dumbbells partway by kicking your knees up. First Position.
  3. Slowly lower the dumbbells until they touch the outside of your chest and your pectorals are stretched. Second Position.
  4. Pause in Second Position briefly.
  5. Contracting your pectorals, press the dumbbells back up into First Position with your arms fully extended again.
  6. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Mid Cable Flys
transcript:
1. Set two ends of the cable machine to a medium height. Standing upright, grip handles attached to the cable with your palms facing forwards. Step and lean forward to release the weight from the stack. The weight should be pulling your arms back, stretching your pectorals. First Position.
  2. Maintaining a slight bend in your elbow, bring the two handles together out in front of you, contracting your pectorals throughout.
  3. Find Second Position where the handles meet in the middle and hold this for a second, still contracting your chest.
  4. Slowly guide the weight back into First Position and pause briefly.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Standing Pallof Press
transcript:
1. Stand upright with your shoulders pinned back and chest out.
  2. Grab a weight plate by the sides with your hands flat, pointing forwards. Hold the plate up to your chest and contract your pectorals. First Position.
  3. Press the plate straight out in front of you, continuing to contract your chest, until your arms are fully extended. Second Position.
  4. Slow and controlled, bring the plate back to your chest in First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Bench Press
transcript:
1. Back slightly arched, shoulders pinned back, lie down on a flat bench.
  2. Grip the bar a few inches outside shoulder width and lift it from the rack. Hold it straight up, arms locked, above your chest. First Position.
  3. Take a deep breath and slowly lower the bar. Touch your chest and pause briefly. Second Position.
  4. Maintain your back arch and shoulder position. Contract your chest and press the bar. Lock your arms back into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Upper Cable Flys
transcript:
1. Set two ends of the cable machine to a high height. Standing upright, grip handles attached to the cable with your palms facing forwards. Step and lean forward to release the weight from the stack. The weight should be pulling your arms back, stretching your pectorals. First Position.
  2. Maintaining a slight bend in your elbow, bring the two handles together out in front of you, contracting your pectorals throughout.
  3. Find Second Position where the handles meet in the middle and hold this for a second, still contracting your chest.
  4. Slowly guide the weight back into First Position and pause briefly.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Decline Bench Press
transcript:
1. Back slightly arched, shoulders pinned back, lie down on a decline bench.
  2. Grip the bar a few inches outside shoulder width and lift it from the rack. Hold it straight up, arms locked, above your chest. First Position.
  3. Take a deep breath and slowly lower the bar. Touch your chest and pause briefly. Second Position.
  4. Maintain your back arch and shoulder position. Contract your chest and press the bar. Lock your arms back into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Decline Dumbbell Bench Press
transcript:
1. Set a bench to a decline position. Sit on the bench and grab a dumbbell in either hand and rest them on the ends of your legs. 
  2. Fall back to lie on the bench, raising the dumbbells upright above you with your arms extended. It may help to lift the dumbbells partway by kicking your knees up. First Position.
  3. Slowly lower the dumbbells until they touch the outside of your chest and your pectorals are stretched. Second Position.
  4. Pause in Second Position briefly.
  5. Contracting your pectorals, press the dumbbells back up into First Position with your arms fully extended again.
  6. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Incline Dumbbell Bench Press
transcript:
1. Set a bench to an incline position. Sit on the bench and grab a dumbbell in either hand and rest them on the ends of your legs. 
  2. Fall back to lie on the bench, raising the dumbbells upright above you with your arms extended. It may help to lift the dumbbells partway by kicking your knees up. First Position.
  3. Slowly lower the dumbbells until they touch the outside of your chest and your pectorals are stretched. Second Position.
  4. Pause in Second Position briefly.
  5. Contracting your chest, press the dumbbells back up into First Position with your arms fully extended again.
  6. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Lower Cable Flys
transcript:
1. Set two ends of the cable machine to a low height. Standing upright, grip the handles attached to the cable with your palms facing forwards. Step and lean forward to release the weight from the stack. The weight should be pulling your arms back, stretching your chest. First Position.
  2. Maintaining a slight bend in your elbow, bring the two handles up and together out in front of you, contracting your chest throughout.
  3. Find Second Position where the handles meet in the middle, at chest height, and hold this for a second.
  4. Slowly guide the weight back into First Position and pause briefly.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Medicine Ball Rolling Press Up
transcript:
1. In a press up position, place both hands on a medicine ball with your arms fully extended. First Position.
  2. Bring one arm out to the side and place your hand on the floor. Slowly lower yourself down until your chest almost touches the floor. Second Position.
  3. Contract your chest muscles and press your upper body back up into First Position, locking your arms into full extension.
  4. Repeat this with your other arm.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Dumbbell Pullovers
transcript:
1. Hold one end of a dumbbell, creating a triangle with your first fingers and thumbs around the handle, and lie down on a flat bench. 
  2. Hold the dumbbell straight above your chest with a slight bend in your arms and your palms facing upwards. First Position.
  3. Slow and controlled, lower the dumbbell behind your head and over the end of the bench until your upper arm is roughly parallel with your torso. Second Position.
  4. Contract your chest muscles and bring the dumbbell back up into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Dumbbell Flys
transcript:
1. Lie down on a flat bench and hold a dumbbell in either hand directly above your chest, with your arms fully extended and palms facing inwards. First Position. 
  2. Slowly lower the dumbbells out to your side until you feel a full stretch on your chest muscles. Keep your arms extended and palms facing inwards. Second Position.
  3. Squeeze your chest muscles and lift the dumbbells back into First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Leg Press
transcript:
1. Sitting down on the Leg Press, place your feet flat on the platform at roughly shoulder width and grab the side handles. Your legs should be roughly at a right angle. First Position.
  2. Take a deep breath and push away from the platform. Press through your heels, until your legs are just short of full extension. Avoid locking your knees out. Second Position.
  3. Slow and controlled, begin to slide back down into First Position just short of where the weight touches the rack.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Leg Extension
transcript:
1. Sit on the Leg Extension machine, legs under the pad at the ankle. 
  2. Adjust the pad so that your legs are pushed into roughly a right angle. Grab the side handles. First Position.
  3. Contracting your quadriceps and keeping your upper body fixed, extend your legs to just short of full extension. Second Position.
  4. Lower the weight back into First Position slowly, just short of where the weight touches the rack.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Leg Curl
transcript:
1. Sit on the Leg Curl machine, with your upper leg under the top pad and lower leg on top of the bottom pad.
  2. Adjust the bottom pad so that your legs are fully extended. Grab the side handles. First Position.
  3. Contracting your hamstrings and keeping your upper body fixed, pull your legs as far back as possible. Second Position.
  4. Slowly lower the weight back into First Position, just short of where the weight touches the rack.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Front Lunges
transcript:
1. Stand upright, feet together, with a dumbbell in either hand. First Position.
  2. Take a big step forward with one leg and slowly fall into a lunge position, knee almost touching the floor, torso upright. Second Position.
  3. Hold Second Position for a second.
  4. Pressing through your heel, push back up into First Position.
  5. Repeat this for the other leg. 
  6. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Rear Lunges
transcript:
1. Stand upright, feet together, with a dumbbell in either hand. First Position.
  2. Take a long step backwards with one leg. Slowly fall into a lunge position on your front leg until your back knee almost touches the floor, keeping your torso upright. Ensure you're keeping tension on your front leg throughout every rep. Second Position.
  3. Pressing through your heel on your front leg, push back up into First Position.
  4. Repeat this for the other leg. 
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Kettlebell Squats
transcript:
1. Grip a kettlebell at either side of the handle and let it rest out in front of you, arms relaxed. Stand upright with your feet at hip-width and toes pointing slightly outwards. First Position.
  2. Take a deep breath, brace your core and begin to drop into a squat, slowly sitting your hips back and bending your knees. Drop until just before the bottom of the kettlebell hits the floor. Second Position.
  3. Push through the floor with your heel, straighten your legs and extend your hips to get back to First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Barbell Lunge
transcript:
1. Place a barbell across the back of your shoulders and stand upright, feet together. First Position.
  2. Take a big step forward with one leg and slowly fall into a lunge position, knee almost touching the floor, torso upright. Second Position.
  3. Pressing through your heel, push back up into First Position.
  4. Repeat this for your other leg. 
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Dumbbell Goblet Squat
transcript:
1. Grip a dumbbell at one end, one hand on either side of the weight, and hold it up to your chin. Stand upright with your feet at hip-width and toes pointing slightly outwards. First Position.
  2. Take a deep breath, brace your core and begin to drop into a squat, slowly sitting your hips back and bending your knees. Drop until - at minimum - your upper legs are parallel to the floor or - at maximum - your hamstrings touch your calves. Second Position.
  3. Push through the floor with your heel, straighten your legs and extend your hips to get back to First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: EZ Bar Curl
transcript:
1. Standing upright, grip the EZ Bar at shoulder width with your hands facing forwards and elbows tucked close to your side. First Position.
  2. Curl the weight upwards, towards your shoulders, contracting your biceps. Try to keep your upper arm in a locked position.
  3. Continue to curl until you reach Second Position, where your biceps are fully contracted.
  4. Briefly hold and contract Second Position before slowly lowering the weight back into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Squat
transcript:
1. Set the squat rack to shoulder height. Load the bar with your chosen weight. You're all set.
  2. Grip the bar just outside shoulder width. Step under and place the bar across the back of your shoulders.
  3. Lift the bar out of the rack and take a few steps back. Plant your feet at hip-width. Point your toes slightly outwards. First Position.
  4. Take a deep breath, brace your core and begin to drop into a squat, slowly sitting your hips back and bending your knees. Drop until - at minimum - your upper legs are parallel to the floor or - at maximum - your hamstrings touch your calves. Second Position.
  5. Push through the floor with your heel, straighten your legs and extend your hips to get back to First Position.
  6. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Lateral Raises
transcript:
1. Standing neutral, hold a pair of dumbbells by your side. First Position.
  2. Keep a slight elbow bend and raise the dumbbells out to your side, up to shoulder height. Keep steady; swinging is cheating. Second Position.
  3. Hold and contract Second Position for a second.
  4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to your side. First Position again.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Shrugs
transcript:
1. Standing upright, hold a pair of dumbbells down by your side. First Position.
  2. Using your trap muscles, raise your shoulders up as far as possible, as if you're trying to touch your ears with them. Second Position.
  3. Hold and contract Second Position for a second.
  4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to your side. First Position again.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Front Raises
transcript:
1. Standing neutral, hold a pair of dumbbells in front of your legs, palms facing down. First Position.
  2. Lift one dumbbell out in front of you, still at arm's length, up to shoulder height, contracting your shoulders throughout. Keep steady; swinging is cheating. Second Position.
  3. Slowly lower the dumbbell back down to your front. First Position again.
  4. Repeat for your other arm.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Cable Upright Row
transcript:
1. Stand upright, feet together, and grip the bar attached to a cable with an overhand grip, just inside shoulder width. First Position.
  2. Contracting the side of your shoulders and raising your elbows up and to the side, pull the bar up towards your chin. Keep your torso still and avoid any swaying. Second Position.
  3. Hold Second Position for a second.
  4. Slowly lower the bar back into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Face Pulls
transcript:
1. Set a cable machine to roughly head height and use a rope attachment.
  2. Standing upright, grip the ropes with an overhand grip, palms facing down. Lightly pull the weight so it releases from the rack. First Position.
  3. Pull the rope directly towards your face, pulling your hands and shoulders apart as you do so, until the middle of the rope reaches your nose. Second Position.
  4. Hold Second Position briefly, contracting your rear deltoid.
  5. Slowly guide the ropes back into First Position.
  6. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Cable Front Raises
transcript:
1. Stand upright, facing away from a cable machine with the cable and a straight bar attachment between your legs.
  2. Grab the straight bar with an overhand grip, palms facing down, and let it rest at arm's length in front of your thighs. Lift the weight slightly, so it just releases from the stack. First Position.
  3. Contracting your shoulders, lift the bar out in front of you, still at arm's length, up to shoulder height. Second Position.
  4. Hold and contract Second Position briefly.
  5. Slowly lower the bar back down to your front. First Position again.
  6. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Seated Lateral Raise
transcript:
1. Sitting on the end of a bench, hold a pair of dumbbells by your side. First Position.
  2. Keep a slight elbow bend and raise the dumbbells out to your side, up to shoulder height. Keep steady; swinging is cheating. Second Position.
  3. Hold and contract Second Position for a second.
  4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to your side. First Position again.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Seated Shoulder Press
transcript:
1. Sit on an upright bench, grab a dumbbell in either hand and rest them on the ends of your legs. Raise the dumbbells to head height, just above your shoulders. It may help to lift the dumbbells partway by kicking your knees up. First Position.
  2. Press the dumbbells above your head until your arms are fully extended. Second Position.
  3. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to your shoulders and pause in First Position briefly.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Cable Lateral Raises
transcript:
1. Standing sideways alongside a cable machine, grab a handle with an overhand grip and hold onto the cable machine with your other hand. First Position.
  2. Keep a slight elbow bend and raise the handle out to your side, up to shoulder height. Keep steady; swinging is cheating. Second Position.
  3. Slowly lower the handle back down to First Position, short of where the weight touches the rack.
  4. Finish your reps.
  5. Repeat for your other arm.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Seated Arnold Press
transcript:
1. Sit on an upright bench, grab a dumbbell in either hand and rest them on the ends of your legs. Raise the dumbbells above your head, arms fully extended. It may help to lift the dumbbells partway by kicking your knees up. First Position.
  2. Slowly lower the dumbbells down and twist them out in front of you, so your palms are facing towards you, just in front of your shoulders. Second Position.
  3. Mirroring the twist on the negative part of the movement, press the dumbbells back up into First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Steering Wheels
transcript:
1. Stand upright and grab a weight plate at either side. Raise it out in front of you to shoulder height, arms fully extended, and hold it there. First Position.
  2. Twist the plate, either clockwise or anti-clockwise, until one hand is at the top and the other is at the bottom. Second Position.
  3. Replicate this in the opposite direction until your hands swap positions. Third Position.
  4. Return your hands back to First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Clean and Press
transcript:
1. Stand over the barbell in a shoulder-width stance. Let your arms rest by your side, in a neutral position.
  2. Bend at yours hips to grip the bar with a double overhand grip, palms facing down. First Position.
  3. Take a deep breath, retract your shoulder blades, brace your core and bend your knees until your shins make contact with the bar. Second Position.
  4. Drive through your heels, pushing the floor away, to lift the bar.
  5. As the bar moves past your knee, forcefully extend your body upwards, almost jumping off the ground. At the same time, use your shoulders to pull the bar upwards until it reaches the front of your shoulders as you return to standing. Rest the bar there in Third Position.
  6. Your palms should now be facing upwards. Press the bar above your head until your arms are fully extended. Fourth Position.
  7. Slowly lower the bar back down to Third Position again, and then guide the bar back to the floor by dropping it from your shoulders, bending at your hips and controlling a fall back into First Position.
  8. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Behind The Neck Press
transcript:
1. Stand upright with your feet at shoulder-width. Grip the barbell just outside shoulder width and place it across the back of your shoulders, behind your neck.
  2. Press the bar up slightly so it's released from the back of your shoulders. First Position.
  3. Press the bar from behind your head and straight up above you until your arms are fully extended. Make sure you keep your back and legs straight throughout the movement. Second Position.
  4. Slowly lower the bar back down behind your head and into First Position again.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Hanging Knee Raises
transcript:
1. Hang from a pull up bar with your arms and legs fully extended. Keep your core tight. First Position.
  2. Bring your knees up to your chest by flexing at the knee, rolling your pelvis forward and contracting your abs. Second Position.
  3. Hold Second Position briefly.
  4. Slowly lower your legs back down into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Cable Crunches
transcript:
1. Kneel down in front of a cable machine and hold the ropes attached at the sides of your head, lightly releasing the weight from the rack. First Position.
  2. Bend at your hips, flex your spine and contract your abs to pull the weight downwards and towards you. Find Second Position where your elbows reach your knees.
  3. Slowly lower the weight back up into First Position, just short of where the weight touches the rack.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Stiff Leg Deadlift
transcript:
1. Stand upright with a very slight bend in your knees and hold either two dumbbells or a barbell just in front of you at arm's length. First Position.
  2. Maintaining the same angle at your knee, slowly bend at your hips and lower the dumbbells straight down, above your feet. Continue to fall until you feel a stretch on your hamstrings. Keep your neck and back straight throughout the movement. Second Position.
  3. Extend your hips and drive them forward to bring the dumbbells back up and return to stand in First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Medicine Ball Squat
transcript:
1. Grab a medicine ball at either side and hold it out in front of you at shoulder height, arms fully extended. Stand upright with your feet at hip-width and toes pointing slightly outwards. First Position.
  2. Take a deep breath, brace your core and begin to drop into a squat, slowly sitting your hips back and bending your knees. Drop until - at minimum - your upper legs are parallel to the floor or - at maximum - your hamstrings touch your calves. Second Position.
  3. Push through the floor with your heel, straighten your legs and extend your hips to get back to First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Plank
transcript:
1. Lie face down on the floor or an exercise mat and lift your body away from the floor, using only your toes and lower arms to support your weight. First Position.
  2. Hold First Position, keeping your legs, torso and head straight throughout.
  3. Do your time.

name: Seated Calf Raise
transcript:
1. Sitting down on a Leg Press machine, place the upper half of your feet flat on the bottom of the platform at roughly shoulder width. The lower half of your feet should be hanging under the platform.
  2. Push away from the platform until your legs are just short of full extension. Avoid locking your knees out. First Position.
  3. Press on the platform through the balls of your feet and push away, raising your heel, until your ankle is fully extended. Contract your calf muscles throughout. Second Position.
  4. Slow and controlled, slide back down into First Position just short of where the weight touches the rack.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Box Jumps
transcript:
1. Stand upright behind a box that's roughly the height of your knees. Plant your feet at hip-width. Point your toes slightly outwards. First Position.
  2. Take a deep breath, brace your core and begin to drop into a squat, slowly sitting your hips back and bending your knees. Drop until - at minimum - your upper legs are parallel to the floor or - at maximum - your hamstrings touch your calves. Second Position.
  3. Push through the floor with your heels, straighten your legs and extend your hips to move out of Second Position and jump up and forwards.
  4. Land your feet on the box in front of you. Third Position.
  5. Step down from the box, back into First Position.
  6. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Box Power Step Ups
transcript:
1. Stand upright behind a box that's roughly the height of your knees. Keep one foot on the floor and hover the other foot just above the box. First Position.
  2. Plant the hovering foot down on the box and step up through that leg, driving your other leg upwards and lifting that knee towards your chest. Second Position.
  3. Step back down from the box with your raised leg and hover your leading foot back above the box. First Position again.
  4. Finish your reps.
  5. Repeat for your other leg.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Box Step Ups
transcript:
1. Stand upright behind a box that's roughly the height of your knees. Plant your feet at shoulder-width. First Position.
  2. Lead with one leg and plant that foot up on the box. Step up onto the box with that leading leg and follow with your other leg until you're stood upright. Second Position.
  3. Step back down from the box with your leading leg and follow with the other. First Position again.
  4. Finish your reps.
  5. Repeat, leading with the other leg.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Sumo Deadlift
transcript:
1. Stand over the bar, centred over your feet, with a very wide stance. Let your arms rest by your side in a neutral position.
  2. Bend at your hips to grip the bar, either double overhand or alternating grip. First Position.
  3. Taking a deep breath, retract your shoulder blades, brace your core and lower your hips until your shins make contact with the bar. Second Position.
  4. Drive through your heels, pushing the floor away, to lift the bar.
  5. As you reach the top, pull the bar back, retracting your shoulder blades and driving your hips forward. Keep your neck and spine straight throughout. Third Position.
  6. Guide the bar to the floor by bending at your hips and controlling a fall back into First Position.
  7. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Jump Lunges
transcript:
1. Stand upright in front of a platform that's roughly half a foot in height. Place one foot behind you and onto the platform. First Position.
  2. Squat down on your front leg, sitting your hips down and bending your knee, until your back knee almost touches the floor. Second Position.
  3. Push through the floor with your leading foot, extend your hips and straighten your leg to move out of the lunge position. Jump your front leg off the floor and kick your knee up as high as you can, keeping your back leg on the platform behind you.
  4. Land the jump back in First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.
  6. Repeat for your other leg.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Dumbbell Overhead Press
transcript:
1. Sit on an upright bench, grab a dumbbell in either hand and rest them on the ends of your legs. Raise the dumbbells to head height, just above your shoulders. It may help to lift the dumbbells partway by kicking your knees up. First Position.
  2. Press the dumbbells above your head until your arms are fully extended. Second Position.
  3. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to your shoulders and pause in First Position briefly.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Side Bend
transcript:
1. Stand upright and hold a weight plate in one hand down by your side. First Position.
  2. Keeping your neck and back straight, bend sideways at the waist, lowering the weight plate down the side of your leg. Continue until you feel a stretch in your obliques muscles at the side of your waist. Second Position.
  3. Contract your obliques and pull the weight, and your torso, back up into First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.
  5. Repeat on the other side.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Ab Roll Outs
transcript:
1. Load a barbell with a plate either side so it call roll easily. 
  2. Kneel on the floor behind the barbell and grip it with both hands in an overhand grip. First Position.
  3. Slowly roll the barbell forwards, stretching your arms out and lowering your torso towards the floor. Lower yourself as far as you possibly can without your torso actually touching the floor. Second Position.
  4. Contract your core muscles and pull the barbell back towards you, raising your torso back into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Crunches
transcript:
1. Lie flat on your back, plant your feet and bend your legs so your knees are off the floor. Put your hands behind your head. First Position.
  2. Contract your abs to curl your torso upwards, towards you knees. Your head, neck and upper back should all lift from the floor. Second Position.
  3. Slowly lower yourself back down into First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Mountain Climbers
transcript:
1. Get into a press up position with your arms fully extended. First Position.
  2. Pushing through your foot, kick one leg forwards, driving your knee towards your elbow. Second Position.
  3. Bring your leg back to full extension in First Position again.
  4. Repeat for your other leg.
  5. Do your time.

name: Yoga Ball Crunches
transcript:
1. Lie your back flat on a yoga ball, plant your feet on the floor and bend your legs so your knees are roughly at a right angle. Put your hands behind your head. First Position.
  2. Contract your abs to curl your torso upwards. Your head, neck and upper back should all lift from the yoga ball. Second Position.
  3. Slowly lower yourself back down into First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Double Leg Climbers
transcript:
1. Get into a press up position with your arms fully extended. First Position.
  2. Pushing through your feet, jump both legs forwards, driving your knees towards your elbows. Land your feet underneath your torso. Second Position.
  3. Jump your legs back into full extension and First Position again.
  4. Do your time.

name: Burpees
transcript:
1. Stand upright with your feet at shoulder-width. First Position.
  2. Squat down, sitting your hips back and bending your knees, and place both hands on the floor. Second Position.
  3. Kick both legs backwards and land them fully extended so you're in a press up position. Third Position.
  4. Jump your feet back under your hips into Second Position again, squat up and jump off the floor, raising your hands over your head.
  5. Land the jump and return to First Position.
  6. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Bicycle Crunches
transcript:
1. Lie flat on your back and put your hands behind your head.
  2. Lift your upper back and legs just off the floor, bracing your core muscles. First Position.
  3. Bring one elbow to the opposite knee over your torso by raising and twisting your torso and kicking your knee up. Keep your hands behind your head throughout. Second Position.
  4. Slowly lower yourself back down into First Position.
  5. Repeat with the opposite elbow and leg.
  6. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Scissors
transcript:
1. 1.Lie flat on your back, extend your legs out and lift them up so they're just above the floor. First Position.
  2. 2.Keeping your legs fully extended, slightly lift one leg, slightly lower the other and cross them over. Second Position.
  3. 3.Return your legs back into First Position and cross them over in the other direction to find Third Position.
  4. 4.Return your legs into First Position.
  5. 5.Do your time.

name: Russian Twists
transcript:
1. Sit on the floor, bend your legs and lift them just off the floor and lean your upper body back slightly. Your upper body and upper legs should create a V shape. First Position.
  2. Twist your torso to one side and tap the floor with your hands. Second Position.
  3. Twist in the opposite direction, past First Position, and tap the floor on the other side. Third Position.
  4. Return to First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Toe Touches
transcript:
1. Lie your back flat on the floor and position a medicine ball just above your head.
  2. Grab the medicine ball with both hands. Extend your arms and legs out and hold them just above the floor. First Position.
  3. Keep your arms and legs fully extended and bring them directly up above your torso into Second Position.
  4. Lower your arms and legs back down into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Incline Decline Flat Barbell Bench Press
transcript: 1. THIS IS A TEST

name: Toe Touches & Crunch
transcript:
1. Lie your back flat on the floor and position a medicine ball just above your head.
  2. Grab the medicine ball with both hands and lift your arms and legs straight up, fully extended. First Position.
  3. Contract your abs and curl your torso upwards, lifting your shoulder blades off the floor. Lift the medicine ball as close to your feet as possible. Second Position.
  4. Lower your arms and torso back down into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Up and Downs
transcript:
1. Lie flat on your back, extend your legs out and lift them up so they're just above the floor. First Position.
  2. Keeping your legs fully extended, slightly lift one leg and slightly lower the other. Second Position.
  3. Swap your legs over so the higher leg is now the lower leg and vice versa. Third Position.
  4. Continue swapping your legs between Second Position and Third Position.
  5. Do your time.

name: Single Leg Raises
transcript:
1. Lie flat on your back, extend your legs out and lift them up so they're just above the floor. First Position.
  2. Keeping your legs fully extended, raise one leg up while keeping the other just off the floor. Find Second Position where your leg's at a right angle with the floor.
  3. Begin to drop your raised leg back down and, at the same time, bring your other leg up into Second Position.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Weighted Russian Twists
transcript:
1. Sit on the floor, bend your legs and lift them just off the floor and lean your upper body back slightly. Hold a weighted object, such as a kettlebell, above your torso. First Position.
  2. Twist your torso to one side and tap the floor with the weight you're holding. Second Position.
  3. Twist in the opposite direction, past First Position, and tap the floor on the other side. Third Position.
  4. Return to First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Leg Raises
transcript:
1. 1.Lie flat on your back, extend your legs out and lift them up so they're just above the floor. First Position.
  2. 2.Keeping your legs fully extended, raise them up until they're at a right angle with the floor. Second Position.
  3. 3.Drop your legs back down into First Position.
  4. 4.Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Upper Cable Chops
transcript:
1. Stand adjacent to a cable machine set at a high height. Grip the cable handle with both hands and lightly release the weight from the rack. Let the weight twist your torso away from the direction your lower body is facing. First Position.
  2. Contract your core muscles and pull the cable across you and downwards, twisting your torso so it aligns with your lower body again. Second Position.
  3. Slowly guide the cable back into First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.
  5. Repeat in the other direction.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Lower Cable Chops
transcript:
1. Stand adjacent to a cable machine set at a low height. Grip the cable handle with both hands and lightly release the weight from the rack. Let the weight twist your torso away from the direction your lower body is facing. First Position.
  2. Contract your core muscles and pull the cable across you and upwards, twisting your torso so it aligns with your lower body again. Second Position.
  3. Slowly guide the cable back into First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.
  5. Repeat in the other direction.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Sit Ups
transcript:
1. Lie flat on your back, plant your feet and bend your legs so your knees are off the floor. Put your hands behind your head. First Position.
  2. Contract your abs to curl your torso upwards, towards you knees. Your head, neck and back should all lift from the floor. Second Position.
  3. Slowly lower yourself back down into First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Side Plank Lift
transcript:
1. Lie on your side and raise your body up through your forearm and the side of your lower foot. Hold your legs and torso parallel. First Position.
  2. Slowly lower your hips down until the side of your hip touches the floor. Second Position.
  3. Contract your core muscles and raise your hips back up into First Position.
  4. Hold First Position for a second.
  5. Finish your reps.
  6. Repeat for your other side.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Bike
transcript:
1. Adjust the seat to a comfortable height and sit on a machine bike. Secure your feet comfortably on the foot rests, grab the handle bars with both hands and lean forwards slightly.
  2. Pressing off with one foot and using the momentum to press off on the other foot, start pedalling.
  3. Keep going.

name: Jump Ropes
transcript:
1. Hold the ends of a skipping rope in either hand and rest the middle of the rope on the floor behind you.
  2. Raise your arms up and flip the rope over your head and back down in front of you.
  3. Jump over the rope so it passes under your feet.
  4. Without stopping, flip the rope back over your head to repeat the same action.
  5. Keep going.

name: Battle Ropes
transcript:
1. Grab the two ends of the battle ropes and stand at the point where the ropes are almost at full extension. 
  2. Fall into a slight squat, sitting your hips back and bending your knees. Hold the ropes out in front of you.
  3. Keeping your body as stationary as possible, whip the ropes up and down in synchrony, moving only your arms, so the middle of the ropes slam against the floor.
  4. Keep going.

name: Step Ups
transcript:
1. Stand upright behind a platform that's roughly half a foot in height. Plant your feet at shoulder-width.
  2. Step up onto the box with one leg and follow with your other leg, bringing your leading leg back down from the platform before your following leg lands.
  3. The action should be similar to running on the spot, only stepping up and down from the platform in the process.
  4. Keep going.

name: High Knees
transcript:
1. Stand upright with your feet at shoulder-width.
  2. Run on the spot, kicking your knees up as high as you can.
  3. Keep going.

name: Cat Cow
transcript:
1. Put your hands and knees on the floor and push your torso down towards the floor the stretch your back. First Position.
  2. Keeping your arms and legs fixed, pull your torso away from the floor to flex your spine. Your body should form the shape of an upside down U. Second Position.
  3. Hold the stretch in Second Position for a few seconds.
  4. Push your torso back down into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

name: Standing Quad Stretch
transcript:
1. Stand upright with your feet together. First Position.
  2. Kick your foot back and up on one leg and grab it with one hand. Pull your foot in towards your glute, feeling the stretch on your quadricep. Second Position.
  3. Hold the stretch in Second Position for a few seconds.
  4. Lower your leg back down into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.
  6. Repeat for your other leg.

name: Standing Hamstring Stretch
transcript:
1. Stand upright with your feet together. First Position.
  2. Take a small step forward with one leg, keeping the leg straight, and plant your heel on the floor in front on you.
  3. Keeping your back and leg straight, bend at yours hips and reach down to grab the foot of your outstretched leg with both hands. Second Position.
  4. Hold the stretch in Second Position for a few seconds.
  5. Raise your upper body back up and step your feet back together. Back in First Position.
  6. Repeat for your other leg.
  7. Finish your reps.

name: Alternating Bicep Curl
transcript:
1. Standing upright, hold two dumbbells by your side with your palms facing forwards and elbows tucked close to your side. First Position.
  2. Curl one dumbbell upwards, towards your shoulder, keeping your palm in an upwards position. Try to keep your upper arm in a locked position.
  3. Continue to curl until you reach Second Position, where your bicep is fully contracted.
  4. Slowly lower the weight back into First Position.
  5. Repeat for your other arm.
  6. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Close Grip Bench Press
transcript:
1. Back slightly arched, shoulders pinned back, lie down on a flat bench.
  2. Grip the bar at shoulder width and lift it from the rack. Hold it straight up, arms locked, above your chest. First Position.
  3. Take a deep breath and slowly lower the bar, keeping your elbows tucked close to the side of your body to maximise tricep engagement. Touch your chest and pause briefly. Second Position.
  4. Maintain your back arch and shoulder position. Contract your chest and triceps and press the bar, maintaining your elbow tuck. Lock your arms back into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Cross Body Hammer Curl
transcript:
1. Standing upright, hold two dumbbells by your side with a neutral grip and your elbows tucked close to your side. First Position.
  2. Curl one dumbbell up and inwards, towards the centre of your chest, keeping your grip neutral. Try to keep your upper arm in a locked position.
  3. Continue to curl until you reach Second Position, where your biceps are fully contracted.
  4. Slowly lower the weight back into First Position.
  5. Repeat for your other arm.
  6. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: EZ Bar Overhand Curl
transcript:
1. 1.Standing upright, grip the EZ Bar at shoulder width with an overhand grip and your elbows tucked close to your side. Your hands should be facing downwards. First Position.
  2. 2.Curl the weight up towards your shoulders, contracting your biceps. Try to keep your upper arm in a locked position.
  3. 3.Continue to curl until you reach Second Position, where your biceps are fully contracted.
  4. 4.Very slowly lower the weight back into First Position.
  5. 5.Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: EZ Bar Tricep Extensions
transcript:
1. Lie down on a flat bench and hold an EZ Bar straight above you, with your palms facing up just inside shoulder width. First Position.
  2. Slowly begin to lower the bar by letting your hands fall to your forehead. Keep your upper arm in a fixed position.
  3. When the bar lightly touches your forehead and your triceps are fully stretched, you've reached Second Position.
  4. Briefly hold Second Position before pressing the weight back up into First Position, contracting your triceps.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Single Arm Cable Curl
transcript:
1. Standing upright, grip a handle attached to a cable machine with one hand. Face your palm upwards and tuck your elbow in by your side. First Position.
  2. Curl the weight upwards, towards your shoulder, contracting your bicep. Try to keep your upper arm in a locked position.
  3. Continue to curl until you reach Second Position, where your bicep's fully contracted.
  4. Slowly lower the weight back into First Position, just short of where the weight touches the rack.
  5. Finish your reps.
  6. Repeat for your other arm.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Single Arm Tricep Extension
transcript:
1. Standing upright, grab one dumbbell and hold it straight above your head with one arm fully extended. Hold your core with your other arm to stabilise yourself. First Position.
  2. Slowly lower the dumbbell to behind your head into Second Position. Hold this for a second.
  3. Contracting your tricep, press the dumbbell from Second Position back into First Position. 
  4. Finish your reps.
  5. Repeat for your other arm.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Zottman Curls
transcript:
1. Standing upright, hold two dumbbells by your side in a neutral position with your elbows tucked close to your side. First Position.
  2. Curl both dumbbells upwards, towards your shoulders, twisting your palm into an upwards position. Try to keep your upper arm in a locked position.
  3. Continue to curl until you reach Second Position, where your bicep is fully contracted and your palm is facing straight upwards.
  4. Keeping the dumbbells in the same position, twist your hands so your palms face downwards. Third Position.
  5. Slowly lower the weight back into First Position, returning to a neutral grip.
  6. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Chin Up
transcript:
1. Grab the pull-up bar at shoulder width with an underhand grip, hands facing towards you. Retract your shoulder blades and tilt your torso back. First Position.
  2. Bringing your lats up to your elbows, pull your torso up until chin reaches the bar at Second Position. Ensure you contract your back muscles throughout the movement.
  3. Slow and controlled, fall back into First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Pendlay Row
transcript:
1. Bend your knees slightly and bend at your hips so your torso is parallel to the floor. Grip the bar with either an overhand or underhand grip. First Position.
  2. From the floor, pull the barbell up towards your mid-section. Pull through your elbows and keep them tucked close to your side. Contract your back muscles throughout the movement. Second Position. 
  3. Slow and controlled, lower the bar back to the floor and into First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Clean
transcript:
1. Stand over the barbell in a shoulder-width stance. Let your arms rest by your side, in a neutral position.
  2. Bend at yours hips to grip the bar with a double overhand grip, palms facing down. First Position.
  3. Take a deep breath, retract your shoulder blades, brace your core and bend your knees until your shins make contact with the bar. Second Position.
  4. Drive through your heels, pushing the floor away, to lift the bar.
