  5. As the bar moves past your knee, forcefully extend your body upwards, almost jumping off the ground. At the same time, use your shoulders to pull the bar upwards until it reaches the front of your shoulders as you return to standing. Rest the bar there in Third Position.
  6. Slowly guide the bar back to the floor by dropping it from your shoulders, bending at your hips and controlling a fall back into First Position.
  7. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Dumbbell Bent Over Rows
transcript:
1. Hold a dumbbell in either hand, bend your knees slightly and bend at your hips so your torso is at a 45 degree angle, minimum, to the floor. Your palms should be facing towards you. First Position.
  2. Pull the dumbbells up towards your mid-section. Pull through your elbows and keep them tucked close to your side. Contract your back muscles throughout the movement. Second Position.
  3. Slow and controlled, lower the dumbbells back into First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Decline Cable Flys
transcript:
1. In a press up position, place both hands on a medicine ball with your arms fully extended. First Position.
  2. Bring one arm out to the side and place your hand on the floor. Slowly lower yourself down until your chest almost touches the floor. Second Position.
  3. Contract your chest muscles and press your upper body back up into First Position, locking your arms into full extension.
  4. Repeat this with your other arm.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Incline Press Up
transcript:
1. Place your hands on a flat bench and get into a press up position with your arms fully extended. First Position.
  2. Slow lower yourself down until your chest touches the bench. Try to keep your elbows tucked close to your side. Second Position.
  3. Pause briefly in Second Position.
  4. Contract your chest muscles and press your upper body back into First Position, locking your arms into full extension.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Incline Cable Flys
transcript:
1. Set two ends of the cable machine to a low height and place a bench in the middle of the two, in an incline position. Lying flat on the bench, grip the handles attached to the cable with your palms facing forwards. Lift the weight slightly so it's released from the rack and stretching your chest. First Position.
  2. Maintaining a slight bend in your elbow, bring the two handles together above you, contracting your pectorals throughout.
  3. Find Second Position where the handles meet in the middle, directly above your chest, and hold this for a second, still contracting your chest.
  4. Slowly guide the weight back into First Position and pause briefly.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Incline Pallof Press
transcript:
1. Grab a weight plate by the sides with your hands flat, pointing forwards.
  2. Lie down on an incline bench, hold the plate above your chest and contract your chest. First Position.
  3. Press the plate straight up above you, continuing to contract your chest, until your arms are fully extended. Second Position.
  4. Slow and controlled, bring the plate back to your chest in First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Medicine Ball Press Up
transcript:
1. Place your hands on a medicine ball, halfway between the centre and the sides, and get into a press up position with your arms fully extended. First Position.
  2. Slow lower yourself down until just before your chest touches the medicine ball. Try to keep your elbows tucked close to your side. Second Position.
  3. Pause briefly in Second Position.
  4. Contract your chest muscles and press your upper body back into First Position, locking your arms into full extension.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Incline Plate Press
transcript:
1. Grip a plate at either side and lie down on an incline bench. Hold the plate straight up, arms locked, above your chest. First Position.
  2. Take a deep breath and slowly lower the plate. Touch your chest and pause briefly. Second Position.
  3. Contract your chest, press the plate upwards and lock your arms back into First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Box Squat
transcript:
1. Place a knee-high box just behind the position you'll squat in. Set the squat rack to shoulder height. Load the bar with your chosen weight.
  2. Grip the bar just outside shoulder width. Step under and place the bar across the back of your shoulders.
  3. Lift the bar out of the rack and take a few steps back. Plant your feet at hip-width, with the backs of your feet touching the front of the box. Point your toes slightly outwards. First Position.
  4. Take a deep breath, brace your core and begin to drop into a squat, slowly sitting your hips back and bending your knees. Drop until you sit the back of your upper legs flat on the box. Second Position.
  5. Push through the floor with your heels, straighten your legs and extend your hips to get back to First Position.
  6. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Front Squat
transcript:
1. Set the squat rack to shoulder height. Load the bar with your chosen weight. 
  2. Rest the bar across the front on your shoulders, hold your arms out straight in front of you and bring your lower arm back and grip the underside of the bar with your fingers.
  3. Lift the bar out of the rack and take a few steps back. Plant your feet at hip-width. Point your toes slightly outwards. First Position.
  4. Take a deep breath, brace your core and begin to drop into a squat, slowly sitting your hips back and bending your knees. Drop until - at minimum - your upper legs are parallel to the floor or - at maximum - your hamstrings touch your calves. Second Position.
  5. Push through the floor with your heels, straighten your legs and extend your hips to get back to First Position.
  6. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Kettlebell Goblet Squat
transcript:
1. Grip a kettlebell at either side of the handle and hold it up to your chest. Stand upright with your feet at hip-width and toes pointing slightly outwards. First Position.
  2. Take a deep breath, brace your core and begin to drop into a squat, slowly sitting your hips back and bending your knees. Drop until - at minimum - your upper legs are parallel to the floor or - at maximum - your hamstrings touch your calves. Second Position.
  3. Push through the floor with your heel, straighten your legs and extend your hips to get back to First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Squat Jumps
transcript:
1. Stand upright. Plant your feet at hip-width. Point your toes slightly outwards. First Position.
  2. Take a deep breath, brace your core and begin to drop into a squat, slowly sitting your hips back and bending your knees. Drop until - at minimum - your upper legs are parallel to the floor or - at maximum - your hamstrings touch your calves. Second Position.
  3. Push through the floor with your heels, straighten your legs and extend your hips to move out of Second Position and jump approximately one foot off the floor.
  4. Land the jump and return to First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Medicine Ball Squat Throws
transcript:
1. Grab a medicine ball at either side and hold it up to your chin. Stand upright with your feet at hip-width and toes pointing slightly outwards. First Position.
  2. Take a deep breath, brace your core and begin to drop into a squat, slowly sitting your hips back and bending your knees. Drop until - at minimum - your upper legs are parallel to the floor or - at maximum - your hamstrings touch your calves. Second Position.
  3. Push through the floor with your heel, straighten your legs and extend your hips to get back towards First Position.
  4. As you approach First Position, throw the medicine ball roughly a foot in the air and catch it as you begin to squat back into Second Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Split Squat Jumps
transcript:
1. Stand upright with your feet at shoulder-width. First Position.
  2. Take a big step backwards with one leg and simultaneously fall into a squat position with your front leg. Continue to move down until the knee of your back leg almost touches the floor and the upper part of your front leg is parallel to the floor. Second Position.
  3. Push through your heel on your front foot, straighten your leg and extend your hips to move out of Second Position.
  4. As you approach full extension with your front leg, jump upwards, bring your back leg forwards and push your front leg back. Land back in First Position with your front and back legs swapped over.
  5. Repeat the action for your other leg.
  6. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Step Squats
transcript:
1. Stand with your feet either side of a platform that's roughly half a foot in height.
  2. Squat down, sitting your hips back and bending your knees, until your upper leg is at least parallel to the floor. First Position.
  3. Push through the floor with your heels, straighten your legs and extend your hips to move out of the squat. As you approach the top of the squat, jump up off the floor and bring your feet together so you land on the raised platform. Second Position.
  4. Hop down from the platform and drop back down into a squat. First Position again.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Side Lunges
transcript:
1. Stand upright with your feet together. First Position.
  2. Take a big step sideways with one leg and squat down on that leg as deep as you can, sitting your hip down and bending your knee. Second Position.
  3. Push through the floor with your planted foot, straighten your leg and extend your hip to move out of the lunge and return back up to First Position. 
  4. Finish your reps.
  5. Repeat for your other leg.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Curtsy Lunge
transcript:
1. Place a barbell across the back of your shoulders and stand upright with your feet at shoulder width. First Position.
  2. Take a long step backwards and across your body with one leg. If you're stepping with your right leg, step backwards and to the left and vice versa. Fall into a lunge on your front leg, sitting your hip down and bending your knee, until your upper leg is at least parallel to the floor. Second Position.
  3. Press up through the heel on your front foot, straight your front leg and extend your hips to move from the bottom of the lunge and return to First Position.
  4. Repeat this for your other leg. 
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Yoga Ball Rollouts
transcript:
1. Lie flat on your back and rest your feet up on a yoga ball in front of you.
  2. Raise your hips up, so your legs are torso are parallel and your upper back is still on the floor. First Position.
  3. Contract your hamstrings and curl the yoga ball in towards your glutes, until your legs are fully bent. Second Position.
  4. Slowly push the yoga ball back out into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: EZ Bar Upright Row
transcript:
1. Stand upright, feet together, and grip an EZ Bar with an overhand grip, just inside shoulder width. First Position.
  2. Contracting the side of your shoulders and raising your elbows up and to the side, pull the EZ Bar up towards your chin. Keep your torso still and avoid any swaying. Second Position.
  3. Hold Second Position for a second.
  4. Slowly lower the bar back into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Around The Worlds
transcript:
1. Stand upright and grab a weight plate at either side. Hold it up close to your face. First Position.
  2. Orbit the place around your head either clockwise or anti-clockwise. You'll need to drop and raise your wrists and elbows to get the plate around your head. 
  3. Halfway through the movement your hands should be directly behind your head with your elbows flared out to the side. Second Position.
  4. Mirror the first part of the movement to bring to plate back in front of you into First Position again.
  5. Finish your reps.
  6. Repeat in the other direction.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Seated Rear Delt Flys
transcript:
1. Sitting on a bench hold a pair of dumbbells by your side. 
  2. Bend at your hips to lean forward so your torso is almost parallel to the ground. Hold the dumbbells straight down below you at arm's length, palms facing inwards. First Position.
  3. Keep a very slight elbow bend throughout and raise the dumbbells out to your side, in the path of a semi-circle. Find Second Position where your arms are pinned back and roughly parallel to the floor.
  4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down below you. First Position again.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Barbell Hip Thrusts
transcript:
1. Sit on the floor with your back to the side of a bench and rest a loaded barbell over your hips. It may make the exercise more comfortable to use a barbell pad.
  2. Lean the top of your back against the bench and bend your knees. Your upper legs and torso should make a V shape. First Position.
  3. Push through your feet to extend your hips, and the bar, straight up until your upper legs and torso are parallel. Second Position.
  4. Hold and contract Second Position for a second.
  5. Slowly lower the weight back into First Position.
  6. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Glute Bridges
transcript:
1. Lie your torso flat on the floor and plant your feet close to you so your knees are bent. If bodyweight is too easy, rest a loaded barbell across the front of your hips. First Position.
  2. Push through your feet to extend your hips upwards until your upper legs and torso are parallel. Keep your shoulder blades fixed to the floor throughout. Second Position.
  3. Hold and contract your glutes in Second Position for a second.
  4. Slowly lower your hips back down into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Single Leg Glute Bridges
transcript:
1. Lie your torso flat on the floor and plant one foot close to you so your knee's bent and hold the other leg fully extended in the air. If bodyweight is too easy, rest a loaded barbell across the front of your hips. First Position.
  2. Push through your planted foot to extend your hips upwards until your upper legs and torso are parallel. Keep your shoulder blades fixed to the floor throughout. Second Position.
  3. Hold and contract your glutes in Second Position for a second.
  4. Slowly lower your hips back down into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.
  6. Repeat for your other leg.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Side Step Squats
transcript:
1. Stand upright with your feet together.
  2. Squat down, sitting your hips back and bending your knees. First Position.
  3. Maintain your squat position and take a long steps sideways with one leg. Second Position. 
  4. Follow with the other leg, joining your feet back together.
  5. Repeat this again to take another step sideways and find First Position again.
  6. Repeat in the opposite direction.
  7. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Donkey Kickbacks
transcript:
1. Kneel on the floor and get down on your hands and knees, torso parallel to the floor.
  2. Lift one knee slightly up off the floor. Your upper and lower leg should be at roughly at right angle. First Position.
  3. Push your lifted leg backwards and upwards as far as your can, maintaining the bend in your knee. Second Position.
  4. Slowly lower your leg back into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.
  6. Repeat for your other leg.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Kettlebell Swings
transcript:
1. Grip a kettlebell at the top of the handle with both hands and let it rest out in front of you, arms relaxed. Stand upright with your feet just outside shoulder-width and toes pointing slightly outwards. First Position.
  2. Squat down slightly, sitting your hips back and bending your knees, dropping the kettlebell between your legs. Second Position.
  3. Pushing through the floor, drive your hips up and forwards and extend your legs to move out of the squat. Forcefully swing the kettlebell from between your legs and up to shoulder height as you squat. Third Position.
  4. Drop the kettlebell back down into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Hanging Leg Raises
transcript:
1. 1.Hang from a pull up bar with your arms and legs fully extended. Keep your core tight. First Position.
  2. 2.Keeping your legs fully extended, raise them up by rolling your pelvis forwards and contracting your abs. Find Second Position where your legs are at a right angle with your torso.
  3. 3.Hold Second Position briefly.
  4. 4.Slowly lower your legs back down into First Position.
  5. 5.Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Supermans
transcript:
1. Lie flat, face down, on the floor or an exercise mat. Put your hands on your head. First Position.
  2. Lift your legs, head and chest off the floor at the same time. Your body should create the shape of a banana. Second Position.
  3. Lower your legs, head and chest back down to the floor and into First Position again.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Elevated Crunches
transcript:
1. Sit sideways on a flat bench and grip it with both hands.
  2. With a bend in your knees, bring your legs and torso together over the middle of the bench. First Position.
  3. Slowly lie your body down flat, falling your torso back and extending your legs, until your whole body is almost parallel to the floor. Second Position.
  4. Contract your core muscles to bring your torso and legs back up into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Reverse Crunches
transcript:
1. Lie flat on your back, extend your legs out and lift them up so they're just above the floor. First Position.
  2. Keeping your legs fully extended, raise them up by rolling your pelvis upwards and contracting your abs. Find Second Position where your legs at a right angle with the floor.
  3. Once your legs reach Second Position, push them upwards slightly with your lower back. Third Position.
  4. Drop your legs back down into Second Position and then lower them again into First Position.
  5. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Medicine Ball Mountain Climbers
transcript:
1. Get into a press up starting position with both your hands on a medicine ball. First Position.
  2. Pushing through your foot, kick one leg forwards, driving your knee towards your elbow. Second Position.
  3. Bring your leg back to full extension in First Position again.
  4. Repeat for your other leg.
  5. Do your time.

name: Yoga Ball Leg Raises
transcript:
1. Hold a yoga ball between your legs and, with your back lying flat on the floor, extend them out. Lift your legs up slightly so they and the ball are just above the floor. First Position.
  2. Keeping your legs fully extended, raise them up by rolling your pelvis upwards and contracting your abs. Find Second Position where your legs at a right angle with the floor.
  3. Drop your legs back down into First Position.
  4. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.

name: Yoga Ball Transfers
transcript:
1. Lie your back flat on the floor and position a yoga ball just above your head.
  2. Grab the yoga ball with both hands. Extend your arms and legs out and hold them just above the floor. First Position.
  3. Keep your arms and legs fully extended and bring them directly up above your torso into Second Position. Pass the ball from your hands to between your legs.
  4. With the ball now being held by legs, lower your arms and legs back down into First Position.
  5. Repeat, this time passing the ball from between your legs to your hands.
  6. Finish your reps.

There's no place for egos in the gym. Always lift with a weight that's comfortable and controllable. If you experience any pain, put your safety first and stop.
